intro: Seseli rhodopeum, commonly known as Rhodope Seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Rhodope Mountains in Bulgaria. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and limestone-rich soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Seseli rhodopeum is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal properties.
